subject: Re: writing a test case for a function which returns void
msgSnippet: ... Yes. Func(x,y) does at least one thing. Write an assertion to test that thing happened. For example, changing state of some object, firing an event,
messageBody:
> I am novice in Junit. So bear with me. Does it make sense to write a test
> case for a function which returns
> void. For example for a function like
>
> public void Func( int x, int y){
> }

Yes. Func(x,y) does at least one thing. Write an assertion to test that
thing happened. For example, changing state of some object, firing an event,
invoking a method on another object.

The difficult part, especially writing new tests for old code, is how to
code the assertion.

If you have specific code to ask about, show us and ask. We'll help.

JBR.
